Indef Sebutkan 3 Tantangan Utama Bos Baru Bank Mandiri
05 Nov 2019, 00:37 by Eko Wahyudi, Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Ekonom senior dari Institute for Development of Economics and Finance (Indef) Aviliani mengatakan tantangan Direktur Utama Bank Mandiri lumayan berat. Pasalnya, bab tersebut merupakan yang masuk dalam BUKU VI, maka menjadi katalisator oleh bank-bank lain di Indonesia.
"Jadi kalau Bank Mandiri ada apa-apa, ini pasti akan menjadi problem nasional," kata Aviliani di Bursa Efek Indonesia, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Aviliani memperkirakan situasi perekonomian dunia selama dua tahun ke depan akan mengalami masa sulit. "Bahkan perekonomian domestik pun ikut diperkirakan menurun," ucapnya.
Oleh karena itu, Aviliani menilai Dirut Bank Mandiri yang akan datang harus bisa menggenjot permintaan kredit yang mulai menurun. Walaupun sektor infrastruktur masih diharapkan menjadi penolong, namun saat ini korporasi pada sektor pembangunan ini telah mengalami over leverage. "Maka harus mencari terobosan-terobosan sektor-sektor apa yang masih memberikan kemungkinan memberikan kredit."
Kedua, menurut Aviliani, bos baru bank terbesar itu harus bisa menekan non performing loan (NPL) yang selama ini jadi salah satu pekerjaan rumah sektor perbankan, dan bagaimana bisa menyelesaikan kredit-kredit yang bermasalah. "Jadi harus membuat skema-skema supaya NPL ini tidak terus meningkat, tapi bisa melalui restrukturisasi," tuturnya.
Hal ini juga bisa menjadi tugas berat Bank Mandiri yang melayani kredit-kredit korporasi harus mengantisipasi banyak perusahaan yang tumbang dan tidak bisa membayar kreditnya. Ketiga, karena Bank Mandiri berkomitmen meningkatkan kredit usaha rakyat (KUR), maka pemimpin perusahaan pelat merah ini yang baru nanti harus bisa memilah mana sektor-sektor produktif yang berorientasi kepada ekspor dan subtitusi impor.
Sebelumnya nama Direktur Corporate Banking Bank Mandiri Royke Tumilaar mencuat sebagai kandidat kuat Direktur Utama perseroan untuk mengisi kekosongan yang ditinggalkan Kartika Wirjoatmodjo lantaran ditunjuk menjadi Wakil Menteri BUMN. Kementerian BUMN dikabarkan telah menyetorkan nama kandidat direktur utama Bank Mandiri ke Otoritas Jasa Keuangan dan Presiden Joko Widodo dan Jokowi.
Royke, yang namanya selalu muncul dalam setiap pemilihan calon Direktur Utama Bank Mandiri, mengaku tak tahu masuk daftar yang disodorkan ke OJK dan Istana. Royke mengaku sedang berada di Toronto, Kanada, saat dihubungi pada Kamis, 31 Oktober lalu.

Indef Mentioned 3 Main Challenges of Bank Mandiri's New Boss
05 Nov 2019, 00:37 by Eko Wahyudi, Rr. Ariyani Yakti Widyastuti
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Senior economist from the Institute for Development of Economics and Finance (Indef) Aviliani said that the challenges faced by the President Director of Bank Mandiri were quite heavy. The reason is that this chapter is included in BOOK VI, thus becoming a catalyst by other banks in Indonesia.
"So if Bank Mandiri has anything, this will definitely become a national problem," Aviliani said on the Indonesia Stock Exchange, Monday, November 4, 2019.
Aviliani estimates that the world economic situation for the next two years will have a difficult time. "Even the domestic economy is also expected to decline," he said.
Therefore, Aviliani assessed that the upcoming President Director of Bank Mandiri must be able to boost credit demand which began to decline. Although the infrastructure sector is still expected to be a helper, now the corporation in this development sector has experienced over leverage. "Then we must look for breakthroughs in what sectors still provide the possibility of providing credit."
Secondly, according to Aviliani, the new bank's biggest boss must be able to suppress the non-performing loan (NPL) which has been one of the banking sector's homeworks, and how to solve problem loans. "So we have to make schemes so that the NPL does not continue to increase, but can go through restructuring," he said.
This can also be a difficult task for Bank Mandiri, which serves corporate loans, and must anticipate many companies that have fallen and cannot pay their loans. Third, because Bank Mandiri is committed to increasing the people's business credit (KUR), the new state-owned company leaders must be able to sort out which productive sectors are oriented towards export and import substitution.
Previously the name of Bank Mandiri Corporate Banking Director Royke Tumilaar emerged as a strong candidate for the President Director of the company to fill the vacancy left by Kartika Wirjoatmodjo because he was appointed as Deputy Minister of BUMN. The BUMN Ministry is reported to have deposited the names of Bank Mandiri's president director candidates to the Financial Services Authority and President Joko Widodo and Jokowi.
Royke, whose name always appears in every election of Bank Mandiri's Managing Director candidates, claimed he did not know that he was on the list offered to the OJK and the Palace. Royke claimed to be in Toronto, Canada, when contacted on Thursday, October 31 last.
